(PTI) 
With the global wealth expected to rise by 35 per cent over the next decade, India is likely to remain among the top performing wealth markets along with China, Mauritius, Sri Lanka and Vietnam, a report said on Wednesday. The report titled ‘The 2017 Global Wealth Review’ lists global wealth and its migration trends over the past year (2016), with projections up to 2026. “Global wealth is expected to rise by 35 per cent over the next decade (2016-2026). The top performing wealth markets are expected to be Vietnam, China, India, Mauritius and Sri Lanka,” the report by global wealth intelligence and market research company ‘New World Wealth’ said. 
“There are approximately 13.6 million HNWIs (high net worth individuals), i.e. millionaires, in the world at the end of 2016 while the worldwide HNWI wealth stood at $69 trillion,” it said.
